text:
I want to create a struct with a field:
```mutable struct myStruct
       H
end```
where the possible values for the field H are A,B,C,D. Note that A,B,C,D are not alphabetical characters or string, they are values of myStruct type. How can I define such a set of values for the field H and complete my struct?

text:
You are probably best off using an `enum` for this.
```julia> @enum Vals A B C D

julia> mutable struct MyStruct
           h::Vals
       end

julia> MyStruct(A)
MyStruct(A)

julia> MyStruct(B)
MyStruct(B)```
